member.name: IMFQualityAdvise.DropTime
member.summary: Drops samples over a specified interval of time.
member.param: Amount of time to drop, in 100-nanosecond units. This value is always absolute. If the method is called multiple times, do not add the times from previous calls.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The object does not support this method.

member.name: IMFQualityAdvise.GetDropMode
member.param: Receives the drop mode, specified as a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFQualityAdvise.GetQualityLevel
member.param: Receives the quality level, specified as a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFQualityAdvise.SetDropMode
member.summary: Sets the drop mode. In drop mode, a component drops samples, more or less aggressively depending on the level of the drop mode.
member.param: Requested drop mode, specified as a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The component does not support the specified mode or any higher modes.

member.name: IMFQualityAdvise.SetQualityLevel
member.summary: Sets the quality level. The quality level determines how the component consumes or produces samples.
member.param: Requested quality level, specified as a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The component does not support the specified quality level or any levels below it.

summary.para: Enables the quality manager to adjust the audio or video quality of a component in the pipeline.

This interface is exposed by pipeline components that can adjust their quality. Typically it is exposed by decoders and stream sinks. For example, the enhanced video renderer (EVR) implements this interface. However, media sources can also implement this interface.
To get a pointer to this interface from a media source, call with the service identifier MF_QUALITY_SERVICES. For all other pipeline objects (transforms and media sinks), call QueryInterface.
